com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface getCarrierServiceOptionsForOrdering

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface getCarrierServiceOptionsForOrdering

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getCarrierServiceOptionsForOrdering(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The getCarrierServiceOptionsForOrdering API retrieves a list of carrier services which have the USED_FOR_ORDERING flag as Y and also match Item criteria.

    • Method Detail

      • getCarrierServiceOptionsForOrdering

        org.w3c.dom.Document getCarrierServiceOptionsForOrdering(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                         org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                                  throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                                         java.rmi.RemoteException

        The getCarrierServiceOptionsForOrdering API retrieves a list of carrier services which have the USED_FOR_ORDERING flag as Y and also match Item criteria. The list of carrier services will be a consolidated list consisting of lists owned by the enterprise code of the order, the enterprise code's enterprise hierarchy and hub. If the Item does not allow parcel shipping and the carrier service is of type PARCEL, this carrier service is not returned as an available option. Also, for each returned carrier service option, the delivery start and end dates are calculated by the API. The logic used in calculating the dates is explained below.

        Calculation of delivery dates

        Delivery dates are calculated based on the EarliestShipDate attribute passed in the OrderLine element of the input. If the EarliestShipDate is not passed in input, it is defaulted as mentioned in the Defaulting input data section. Without an EarliestShipDate, delivery dates are not calculated. The DeliveryStartDate and DeliveryEndDate are calculated as follows:
        • Based on the EarliestShipDate, the first possible working day of the ShipNode on or after the EarliestShipDate is calculated. This is done since the passed EarliestShipDate might be a non-working day for the ShipNode.
        • For calculating the DeliveryStartDate, we first calculate the Transit Days. This is the sum of the Minimum Transit Days of the carrier service and the time taken by the carrier service to travel between the ShipNode and the ShipTo location. If the ShipNode and ShipTo locations are the same, Transit Days is zero. Now the DeliveryStartDate is obtained by adding the Transit Days to the first possible working day of the ShipNode.
        • The DeliveryEndDate is calculated by adding the Maximum Transit Days of the carrier service to the first possible working day of the ShipNode.
        • Note: In some situations, owing to the configuration of the carrier service attributes, the calculated DeliveryEndDate could fall before the calculated DeliveryStartDate. When such a scenario occurs, the DeliveryEndDate is internally set to the calculated DeliveryStartDate and this value is returned by the API.

        Defaulting input data

      • To determine the available carrier service options, the carrier service must match the Item criteria. However, passing an ItemID in the OrderLine element is not mandatory. Instead, if either the OrderLineKey OR PrimeLineNo and SubLineNo along with the OrderHeaderKey are passed, ItemID, UnitOfMeasure and ProductClass attributes in the OrderLine element are defaulted from the resulting order line. With the obtained order line, all the blank attributes in the OrderLine element are also defaulted. This applies to the ShipNode and EarliestShipDate attributes as well. Also, the OrderHeaderKey is defaulted using the order line, if it is not passed.
      • If the EnterpriseCode is not provided in input, it is defaulted from the Order Header obtained from the OrderHeaderKey, if available, or the order line which is obtained as explained above.
      • If no OrderLines are passed, they are populated using the OrderHeaderKey, if available. However, only those order lines with status less than shipped status are populated.
      • Note: While defaulting the OrderHeaderKey and EnterpriseCode from the order line, the defaulted attributes will not be shown in the output. They are only done internally to facilitate the calculation of delivery dates.

      Related Documents
      Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

      User Exits: This API invokes the following user exits:

        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.OMPGetCarrierServiceOptionsForOrderingUE

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: No

Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
A valid XML. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

Throws:
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
